intro: Pleurothallis archilarum, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Epidendroideae subfamily and is characterized by its compact growth habit and intricate floral structure. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow and green, often clustered in racemes. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil for optimal growth. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is a subject of interest for botanists and orchid enthusiasts alike.
